question: The Chinese pilgrim Fa-hien visited Kannauj between 399 and 414 A.D. during the reign of which of the following?
explanation: Fa-Hien is the famous Chinese pilgrim who visited India during the rule of Chandra Gupta II. Fa-Hien started from China in 399 A.D. and covering all the way through the deserts came up to Peshawar.
